title: Do I Need to Learn Soroban to Teach My Kid? â€“ Spoiler: I'm Clueless and It's Fine
description: I was worried I'd need to master Soroban before my child could learn. Turns out that's completely unnecessary. Here's why.
imageAlt: Parent wondering about Soroban while child learns independently

content.intro: Before starting, I had this fear: "If I don't understand Soroban, how can I help my kid?" I pictured myself staying up late watching YouTube tutorials, trying to learn before my daughter. Reality? I still don't know how to use a Soroban. My daughter's doing great anyway.

sections.text: I spent a week watching "Soroban basics" videos. I understood maybe 30%. The complement rules? Friends of 5? My brain hurt.
I almost gave up on the idea. If I couldn't get it, how would my 8-year-old?
Then I Just Let Her Try the App
The Sorokid app started her from zero. Step by step. With animations. With practice. With instant feedback.
She didn't need me to explain anything. The app explained it better than I ever could.
Modern Soroban apps are designed for kids to learn independently. Your job is motivation, not instruction.

items: **Ask curious questions:** "How'd you figure that out?"
**Stay consistent:** Same time every day, 15 minutes

sections.text: That's it. I don't need to know the difference between heaven and earth beads. The app handles the teaching.
Because I don't know Soroban, my daughter teaches ME. She explains what she's doing, why she moves certain beads.
Teaching someone else is the best way to learn. So my ignorance actually helps her.
If you're worried about not knowing Soroban, stop. Your child doesn't need a Soroban-expert parent. They need a supportive one.

faq.question: What if my child asks me something I can't answer?
faq.answer: "I don't know, let's look it up together" is a perfectly fine response. Or "Show me how you'd figure it out." Kids learn problem-solving this way.

faq.question: Should I learn Soroban anyway?
faq.answer: Only if you want to. Some parents enjoy learning alongside their kids. But it's not necessary for your child's success.

cta.text: No Soroban knowledge required. The Sorokid app teaches your child everything they need.
